feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly demonstrates a functioning financial application that accepts savings/income inputs, uses market data, and produces asset-allocation and return estimates (Discover + Implement evidence). The Reflect stage further shows awareness of limits and appropriate caution, supporting that the tool operates as a financial app while acknowledging constraints.
- Integrate AI: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration (real-time market data, AI-driven recommendation generation, and a memory state) and gives multiple examples (V1 vs V2 improvements and workflow execution). The student also reflects on benefits and limitations, indicating a robust, applied understanding that meets the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "so, essentially, this is a saving goal investment recommendation generator."

"we are going to execute our workflow. We are going to execute now." / "it needs to sift through a lot of data, sift through the markets, sift through the AI tool to be able to come up with the best recommendation"

"in this one, we are using real time prices and real time rates in the stock market to be able to determine if we should put more into stocks, put more into ETFs, put more into bonds" / "it gives you ... your personalized investment strategy."
criteria.driver_alignment: Discover: student defines the tool as a "saving goal investment recommendation generator" (idea and target use). Implement: student describes executing a workflow, using market data, real-time prices, and a memory/database to generate recommendations. Reflect: student discusses reliability, limitations, and ethical concerns of deploying the financial tool.
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly demonstrates a functioning financial application that accepts savings/income inputs, uses market data, and produces asset-allocation and return estimates (Discover + Implement evidence). The Reflect stage further shows awareness of limits and appropriate caution, supporting that the tool operates as a financial app while acknowledging constraints.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "So, essentially, this is a saving goal investment recommendation generator."

"in this one, we are using real time prices and real time rates in the stock market to be able to determine if we should put more into stocks, put more into ETFs, put more into bonds, all of that stuff."
"it needs to sift through a lot of data, sift through the markets, sift through the AI tool to be able to come up with the best recommendation"
criteria.driver_alignment:
DISCOVER — defined the AI-powered tool and its user goal (saving/investment recommendation).  
IMPLEMENT — describes executing a workflow that uses real-time market data, AI processing, and a memory/database.  
REFLECT — discusses AI benefits (personalization, automation) and limitations (prompt engineering, trust/ethics), showing critical appraisal.
criteria.reasoning: The submission demonstrates concrete AI integration (real-time market data, AI-driven recommendation generation, and a memory state) and gives multiple examples (V1 vs V2 improvements and workflow execution). The student also reflects on benefits and limitations, indicating a robust, applied understanding that meets the PASS standard.
